snippet: A federal judge dismissed an F.D.I.C. suit against nine former officials of Cooperative Bank of Wilmington, N.C., even though examiners had tried to persuade the bank to change its practices.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column examines Federal Judge Terrence W Boyle's decision to dismiss suit filed by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation against former officers and directors of Cooperative Bank; century-old institution pursued disastrous growth strategy that depended on soaring real estate prices, ignoring warnings from examiners about low underwriting standards; holds ruling could encourage other banks to ignore advice and warnings from regulators, so long as it gets a passable rating.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge dismissed an F.D.I.C. suit against nine former officials of Cooperative Bank of Wilmington, N.C., even though examiners had tried to persuade the bank to change its practices.

headline.print_headline: Failed Bank’s Broken Vows Mean Little
headline.main: Failed Bank’s Broken Vows Mean Little
